note.p: Education: Magdalene College, Cambridge. Mus Doc (1801)

Career: Began singing at Westminster Abbey and studied harpsicord; took up composing; Parliamentary reporter for the London Courant; assisted in editing the Morning Post; music critic, European Magazine; organist, St Mary Newington (1785); taught French, Latin and music; jointly published a Musical Dictionary (1786); organist, St Mary Woolnoth (1798); started the "Monthly Musical Journal", the first musical periodical in England (ca 1800); died at house of married daughter, with whom he lived
